column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The burly researcher looks at you appraisingly.
Speak with the lightly built lab assistant.
Pick up the ore-filled crate.
Speak with the lightly built lab assistant and follow his lead.
Speak with the burly researcher.
You look strong, sturdy, and─most importantly─idle. Which is a wonderful coincidence, as I'm in need of a spare pair of hands. Let me explain.
I sent one of my younger colleagues off to the Aesthete's Tholos to organize a shipment of ore...but after a second glance at the order sheet, I realized why it was taking him so blasted long.
Seems the order was more than triple the size we usually handle─something to do with all these large-scale preparations, I suppose. And I can hardly expect that pup to shift it all on his lonesome.
Come and pitch in with the hauling, and I'll make it worth your while. What say you?
Good. Many hands make light work─well, lighter, at least. Let's go.
Please tell me you're the help I was promised...

Oh, thank the stars! My supervisor came past not a moment ago and scooped up half the ore himself. I swear he's part forest troll... But even so, I don't think I can manage the rest without doing myself an injury.
Listen, if I take this crate, do you think you could carry that other load? Once you have it settled into a comfortable grip, I'll lead us to where we need to go.
Yes, that big box there full of ore. And don't ask me about carts─I put in a request <Emphasis>weeks</Emphasis> ago.
Commence hauling?
Follow the lightly built lab assistant and try not to fall behind.
You will have three minutes to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.
I see you're no stranger to hauling heavy things about! Come on─let's get moving before my arms fall off!
Yes, um, I'll need you to actually bring the crate. You know, <Emphasis>physically</Emphasis>.
Where's the rest of the ore? Did you leave it back in the Outer Circuit?
That ought to do it. Come on back to the Archeion, and I'll pay you what you're owed.
Thanks, I can handle the rest from here─the worst of it is over!
Thanks, I can handle the rest from here─the worst of it is over!
I'm glad you came along when you did. I can't be hauling ore all day, and my colleague is not exactly built for hard labor.
The Aesthete's Tholos is where we store our mineral deposits, you see, and it <Emphasis>is</Emphasis> our job to field and fill requests from our fellow researchers...
But we're not equipped to process orders of that quantity, especially if the Central Circuit keeps sending up requisition papers at the same frenzied pace.
We'll run out of stock before long─assuming our backs don't give out first. Anyway, you're not here to listen to me gripe. Take your wages, and good work!
